Accrue.definition: to come into existence as an enforceable claim
Accrue.origin: [Middle French accreue increase, addition to a property, from feminine of accreu , past participle of acreistre to increase]

ac·cru·ing.definition: [Middle Frenchincrease, addition to a property, from feminine of, past participle ofto increase]

1.definition: to accumulate or have due after a period of time [authorized by law to leave…in the maximum amount of 120 days ""]

2.definition: to enter in the books as an accrual

3.definition: to be periodically accumulated in the process of time whether as an increase or a decrease [theof taxes] [allowing the receivable interest to ]
3.accruing: of taxes] [allowing the receivable interest to ]
